messages.message: Hi team, could anyone please confirm if you recognise the email address <mailto:nayuhulcume@tfecay.xyz|nayuhulcume@tfecay.xyz>? It has a user account on prod, and has been logging in, but seems suspicious. The account has been disabled. *Do NOT open the domain.*
On this topic, I think we need an audit of all the accounts that has access to instabase.com (http://instabase.com). What is the best way to do this?
We can pull a list of all the approved user accounts from the database (most people who just sign up land on the waitlist)
the list is quite long though because we have been/are being used by a good number of students
last i checked we had 20k user accounts, I don’t remember how many were approved accounts.
5730 approved accounts as of hack week
77 of which have passwords like `instabase` and `123456`
dude, don’t give my pw away!
Wow quite a lot, do students have to do anything else other than register on prod? Also could we find out how that domain was able to register?

user: jonisouthwell7
registered on: 1/13/2021, 3:58:52 AM

Looks like I can’t manually access the database anymore, so I can’t even see which signup tokens were active on that day. Not sure if any classes are using IB this semester, but if so, that might correspond to the beginning of a semester (i.e. used a signup token that was generated for a class)
From the audit logs it looks like they’ve just been repeatedly logging in since 2/11. Maybe a bot? No audit logs _other_ than login
@Lee did you deactivate it or was it already? If the latter, it was probably never activated, and it’s just a bot
deactivating doesn’t touch the approved flag.
We deactivated it today after I opened the domain.
